discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Secure Shell (SSH) 

A terminal emulation program that looks exactly like Telnet but encrypts the data. SSH has replaced Telnet on the Internet.

questions.question_text: Which of the following protocols provides remote access utilizing port 22?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Nmap 

 A popular open-source network scanner designed to scan a network and create a map of hosts and services by sending out packets and examining the responses. Frequently used as a vulnerability scanner

questions.question_text: After changes were made to a firewall, users are no longer able to access a web server. A network administrator wants to ensure that ports 80 and 443 on the web server are still accessible from the user IP space. Which of the following commands is best suited to perform this testing?
Which of the following attacks would most likely cause duplicate IP addresses in a network?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Rogue DHCP server 

An unauthorized DHCP server installed in a computer network. The rogue DHCP server might be in an unauthorized device installed by a well-meaning user, or it could be malicious as in an on-path attack.

questions.question_text:
An organization wants better network visibility. The organization's requirements include:

• Multivendor/OS-monitoring capabilities
• Real-time collection
• Data correlation

Which of the following meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. SIEM (Security Information and Event Management).

Explanation:

SIEM solutions provide centralized real-time collection, data correlation, and monitoring capabilities from multiple sources across a network, including devices from different vendors and operating systems. SIEMs aggregate logs and events, analyze them for security threats, and generate alerts, offering better network visibility and actionable insights.

questions.question_text: An administrator is evaluating the use of authentication within SNMP. Which of the following is the most secure way of authenticating devices using only SNMP?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Basically a give me question. SNMPv3 most secure of the versions.

Selected Answer: B
B. Use version 3 of SNMP and set up trap messages for critical events on the network.

Explanation:

SNMP version 3 (SNMPv3) is the most secure version of SNMP as it supports both authentication and encryption. It allows for stronger security protocols, such as user-based authentication (using MD5 or SHA) and message encryption (using DES, AES, etc.), ensuring that SNMP communication is protected from eavesdropping and unauthorized access.

choices.D: Use version 2u of SNMP to authenticate devices for network monitoring
choices.B: Use version 3 of SNMP and set up trap messages for critical events on the network
choices.C: Use version 2c of SNMP and use informs to validate device authentication
choices.A: Use version 1 of SNMP and use a community string to serve as a PSK
